title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 22): Mutual Aid Networks as Power With Coordination Patterns
summary: A step-by-step guide to starting horizontal mutual aid networks based on cooperation, not charity, emphasizing replication over scale.

Community.summary: Build horizontal networks of mutual care and support through non-hierarchical organizing.

resources.label: Mutual Aid 101 Guide – Big Door Brigade
The People's Solidarity Hub Mutual Aid Toolkit

level0: Form a core circle of 3-7 trusted neighbors or friends
Start a group chat to coordinate simple mutual aid exchanges
Deliver groceries or share meals with neighbors
level1: Survey your community to identify needs and offers
Create accessible communication systems for your network
level2: Host reflection circles to evolve your practices
Connect with other mutual aid networks for solidarity
level3: Document and share your organizing model with other communities
Support others in starting their own autonomous mutual aid networks
Build lasting infrastructure for community resilience

Knowledge.summary: Develop and share organizing knowledge through horizontal learning and documentation.

level0: Learn about mutual aid principles vs charity models
Study existing mutual aid networks like Bed-Stuy Strong
level1: Practice consensus decision-making in your core group
Document your mutual aid processes and agreements
level2: Host workshops on mutual aid organizing for others
Create zines or newsletters sharing successes and challenges
level3: Develop comprehensive toolkits for mutual aid network formation
Facilitate training exchanges between different mutual aid networks

Narrative.summary: Shift narratives from charity and service to solidarity and interdependence.

level0: Practice talking about mutual aid as natural cooperation, not radical charity
Share stories of successful horizontal organizing in your networks
level1: Challenge charity-based language in community organizing
Frame care as liberation, not management
level2: Lead community conversations about solidarity vs saviorism
Write and share stories about the power of horizontal organizing
level3: Contribute to broader cultural shift toward mutual aid as default community practice
Mentor others in articulating Power With principles
